title.narrative: Evaluating Research Excellence: Actionable Knowledge Through Synthesis and Frameworks
Évaluation de l'excellence en recherche - des connaissances utilisables grâce à la synthèse et à des cadres d'évaluation

description.narrative:
IDRC's corporate strategy notes that it will strive for "excellence" in research, defining excellence as, "methodologically sound, evidence-based, and scientifically valid." But what does "excellence in research" mean? IDRC grantees and programs struggling with this question are trying to find ways to measure research excellence. This is not an abstract concern; in some cases, further grants depend on researchers establishing and meeting quality standards. In all cases, IDRC evaluates its programs against the quality of the research they fund. All programs are committed to doing and supporting the highest quality research that will serve as part of the evidence base for policy, practice, and technological development.
This research project will build on and validate existing knowledge around research excellence. The project team will develop evaluation approaches that reflect the nature of IDRC's work and its partners' perspectives. More specifically, they will: - synthesize and draw key considerations from existing research to help build IDRC-specific evaluation approaches; - articulate new frameworks to assess excellence in IDRC supported-research; - strengthen skills and approaches for measuring research excellence within IDRC; and, - share new knowledge with the broader research for development and evaluation community.
IDRC's Corporate Strategy and Evaluation Division (CSED) has been conducting an organization-wide strategic evaluation whose aim is to explore and apply tools and approaches for evaluating research excellence. The study started in 2011 and is expected to conclude within three years. Those who will use the evaluation include IDRC program staff, senior management, Board of Governors, and CSED, along with the wider scientific, research for development, and evaluation communities.
This project will build on initial efforts. Evaluators will synthesize the findings and build a framework for IDRC's research excellence strategic evaluation. The team will build actionable frameworks for IDRC, its research recipients, and IDRC-commissioned evaluators (to use in project- and program-level evaluations). The team will consult with researchers, funders, and IDRC staff to validate the synthesis study, scope the intellectual and practical terrain, and gather ideas for the emerging frameworks.
